s.text: It would make a wonderful tale if these two (both associated with the American Enterprise Institute, a conservative Washington think tank) had discovered what the entire finance establishment had missed, and written the next Wealth of Nations . The true tale, sadly, is somewhat less inspiring.
You can show mathematically that $6 a year forever and $1 this year plus $1.
(Maybe it's not too late to call the book Dow 40,000 .)
This week, as the Dow hit 10,000, Glassman and Hassett repeat their argument in the Journal . They admit that the "financial establishment" has reacted with guffaws.
(Maybe it's not too late to call the book Dow 40,000 .)
Glassman begins by asking whether you'd rather have $100 in a savings account that pays 6 percent interest or a $100 share of a company that earned $1 per share last year.
